channel.title: Auto News | Latest Automobiles & Auto Industry Information and Updates: ET Auto : ETAuto.com
channel.description: Find the latest automobile Auto Insight, News & Articles from all top sources for the Indian Auto industry on ET Auto.

image.title: Auto News | Latest Automobiles & Auto Industry Information and Updates: ET Auto : ETAuto.com

item.title: GreenLine and Sterlite Copper partner for sustainable LNG logistics
item.description: The collaboration commenced with the official flag-off of LNG trucks at Vedanta's Sterlite Copper Plant in Silvassa. These vehicles will play a key role in transporting finished goods to the northern region using a reverse logistics model, significantly improving logistics efficiency while reducing carbon emissions.

item.title: IAC urges government to recognise Auto LPG as eco-friendly fuel, pushes for tax reforms
item.description: The Indian Auto LPG Coalition has urged the Ministry of Environment to recognise Auto LPG as an eco-friendly alternative fuel. Highlighting its lower emissions and cost benefits, the coalition calls for supportive policies, tax incentives, and a reduced GST rate to promote its adoption and align with India's environmental goals.

item.title: Infosys to set up tech hub in Bengaluru for Swedish electric automotive manufacturer Polestar
item.description: Infosys has partnered with Swedish electric car brand Polestar to develop in-car infotainment, software, and cloud-powered digital services. Infosys will establish a global technology hub for Polestar in Bengaluru, focusing on EV software development and validation. This collaboration aims to enhance Polestar's product management and customer engagement through advanced digital solutions.

item.title: After BaaS, here's another concept for EVs called BaaB
item.description: Axrad Renewpower Agri Machines (ARAM), a Coimbatore-based startup, has unveiled a prototype of its self-charging electric light commercial vehicle (LCV), code-named ACV. This vehicle introduces groundbreaking technology, including the Body as a Battery concept, which integrates solar panels into the vehicle's body to generate power, reducing reliance on traditional battery charging methods.

item.title: Uber, Chinese self-driving tech startup announce partnership to launch robotaxis in UAE
item.description: WeRide's first collaboration with a global ride-hailing platform will help the company expand its reach beyond China, while Uber takes another towards incorporating robotaxis into its platform.

item.title: Biden's car-tech ban is a powerful new weapon against Chinese EVs
item.description: The Biden administration has proposed a ban on Chinese connected-car technology to counter the influx of cheap Chinese electric vehicles. This measure, announced by the U.S. Commerce Department, aims to protect U.S. automakers and address national-security concerns related to espionage and economic threats posed by China's EV sector.

item.title: ADAS and AD to co-exist, transform auto ecosystem
item.description: The experts point on EVs likely to bring better outputs at higher autonomy levels due to their inherent compatibility with advanced electronic systems and overall efficiency as against ICEs and other fuel driven vehicles.

item.title: Foxconn, Stellantis JV set up R&D for automotive semiconductors tech in India
item.description: SiliconAuto, backed by Foxconn, has opened an R&D centre in Bengaluru to focus on semiconductor product design and system-on-chip development for the automotive sector. The centre aims to drive innovation in electric vehicles, autonomous driving, and connected car technologies. The company plans to recruit top engineers and designers to strengthen its team.

item.title: Russia's Nornickel opens EV battery R&D centre
item.description: Russia's Nornickel has launched an R&D centre in St. Petersburg to explore the use of nickel-containing cathode active materials in electric batteries. This marks the company's initial step into battery production, aligning with Russia's goal of full-cycle battery production for electric transportation. The decision on a production facility will be made within a year.

item.title: Mercedes-Benz to accelerate autonomous driving on German autobahns
item.description: The auto industry has defined five levels of autonomous driving, from cruise control at level one to fully self-driving cars at level five. Mercedes cars will operate at level 3 in Germany under the new system.

item.title: Hyundai and Skoda join forces to accelerate hydrogen mobility
item.description: Hyundai Motor Company and Škoda Group have signed an MOU to collaborate on establishing a hydrogen mobility ecosystem. The partnership aims to accelerate hydrogen adoption and advance carbon neutrality. They will explore fuel cell systems, energy-efficient solutions, and broader hydrogen ecosystem opportunities, focusing on global markets including the Czech Republic.

item.title: AI-powered robots begin manufacturing cars in bid to raise automation efficiency
item.description: Artificial intelligence is enhancing industrial robots, making manufacturing more efficient and safer. Automakers are leading this trend, with significant advancements in robotics research at institutions like MIT and companies like Toyota. The shift to electric vehicles is also providing new opportunities for increased productivity using the latest robotic technology.

item.title: Hybrids compromise green mobility
item.description: As one industry observer puts it, “The façade of hybrids being green is a ruse; they are primarily fossil fuel vehicles dressed in electric clothing. When it comes to achieving zero emissions, only full electric vehicles can deliver.”

item.title: Waymo in talks with Hyundai Motor to produce self-driving taxis
item.description: Officials at Waymo and Hyundai Motor have met more than three times to discuss a plan to use Hyundai's Ioniq 5 electric vehicles for Waymo's sixth-generation self-driving technology, the report said, adding that the vehicles would replace the offerings from China's Zeekr, which Waymo is currently testing.

item.title: ZF secures long-term deal with Ford Trucks to power electric heavy vehicles
item.description: ZF’s Commercial Vehicle Solutions division has secured a long-term agreement with Ford Trucks to supply e-mobility technologies for their upcoming electrified heavy trucks. This partnership highlights ZF's leading position in Europe for electric commercial drives and supports Ford Trucks' mission to develop sustainable transport solutions.

item.title: Tata, Analog Devices to explore opportunities for semiconductor manufacturing in India
item.description: "Tata Electronics, Tata Motors and Tejas Networks signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with ADI to enhance strategic and business cooperation, explore opportunities for semiconductor manufacturing in India, and use ADI's products in Tata applications like electric vehicles and network infrastructure," the statement said.

item.title: India, US for giving push to sustainable aviation fuel, hydrogen in buses
item.description: "While recognising the need to work towards a just, orderly and sustainable energy transition, which prioritises access to reliable, affordable, and clean energy supplies, the (two) sides welcomed the important role that energy trade plays in supporting the national priorities of both countries," the statement said.

item.title: Drive System Design showcases innovative electrified propulsion systems at IAA Transportation 2024
item.description: Drive System Design (DSD), acquired by Hinduja Tech in 2022, will showcase its latest electrified propulsion systems at IAA Transportation 2024 in Hannover. DSD's expertise spans systems integration, performance enhancement, and development testing, offering innovative solutions for electric, hybrid, and conventional powertrains.

item.title: Drivers more likely to be distracted while using partial automation tech, study shows
item.description: Insurance Institute for Highway Safety (IIHS) conducted month-long studies with two such systems - Tesla's Autopilot and Volvo's Pilot Assist - to examine driver behavior when the technology was in use and how it evolved over time.

item.title: Renesas expands R&D in India, eyes growth in automotive and IoT sectors
item.description: In an effort to improve its skills in India, Renesas is also actively collaborating with local partners. It recently established an outsourced semiconductor assembly and test (OSAT) partnership with CG Power, which is a step toward strengthening the local supply chain.
